channel.title: Proposition for a JavaBeans-style server
channel.description:
OK, so lately (ok fine, always), I've been seeing veeeeery ugly server sources, except for a few such as Silab's HybridScape. So I've been thinking, let's make a more standards-compliant server with an architecture similar to the one below. All entities and objects should be serializable (as are JavaBeans), and the flow of the program should not be time-driven, but rather, event driven, as in, rather than every time someone calls kickPlayer(), rather than being add to a kick roster, and having to wait until PlayerHandler.process() is called, the player is kicked automatically. This will make the server less resource-dependent, and will consume less time. I already started to convert a clean winterlove source into an CleanServ source, and I'd like your comments on this idea.
Thank you, ~io9`
